rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The effect of left atrial pressure on the development of pulmonary edema
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The effect of increasing mean left atrial pressure (PLA) on the development of pulmonary edema was studied in 21 semi-upright dogs, whose lungs were perfused in situ. In 17 experimental animals, PLA was increased in increments of 5 mm Hg until edema developed. At each level of PLA, vascular volume (VV) and extravascular lung water (ELW) were measured by the triple indicator-dilution technique and diffusing capacity (DLCO) by a modified single-breath technique.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physiology
